intro: Waltheria gracilis, commonly known as the slender waltheria, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, delicate leaves. Its flowers are typically pale pink or white, with five petals and a prominent yellow center. Waltheria gracilis is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its elegant appearance and adaptability to various soil types.
